com.percussion.loader
Class PSItemContext

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.loader.objectstore.PSLoaderComponent
      com.percussion.loader.PSItemContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class PSItemContext
extends PSLoaderComponent
implements Serializable

This class is used to hold all of the information associated with the transformation of a resource into content items, including the original data and the resulting standard item. This is passed from step to step throughout the processing of the data. (For those of you familiar with the Rhythmyx server, it is very similar to the PSExecutionData.)

Throughout this class, any reference to a type of 'text' is determined by looking at the leading part of the mime type. If it is 'text' (e.g., as in text/plain) or application/xml, then the resource is considered text, otherwise it is considered binary.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

STATUS_NEW

public static final String STATUS_NEW
One of the allowed values for the item's delta status. The meaning of this value is that a new item will be created on the Rhythmyx server.

See Also:
getStatus(), setStatus(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

STATUS_MODIFIED

public static final String STATUS_MODIFIED
One of the allowed values for the item's delta status. The meaning of this value is that this item matches an existing item on the Rhythmyx server. The existing item will be updated with the content from this item.

See Also:
getStatus(), setStatus(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

STATUS_UNCHANGED

public static final String STATUS_UNCHANGED
One of the allowed values for the item's delta status. The meaning of this value is that this item will not be sent to the server because it has not been modified since the last time it was loaded.

See Also:
getStatus(), setStatus(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

STATUS_EXCLUDED

public static final String STATUS_EXCLUDED
One of the allowed values for the item's delta status. The meaning of this value is that this item will not be sent to the server because it is excluded.

See Also:
getStatus(), setStatus(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

STATUS_ERROR

public static final String STATUS_ERROR
One of the allowed values for the item's delta status. The meaning of this value is that this item will not be sent to the server because its content is invalid. For example, its contents may not be a well formed XML, but well formed XML is required for the extractor of this item.

See Also:
getStatus(), setStatus(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

XML_NODE_NAME

public static final String XML_NODE_NAME
The XML node name of this object.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

m_resId

protected String m_resId
A resource identifier that uniquely identifies the item beeing created. This depends on the content selector and might be a url, file, etc.. Initialized in constructor, never null or empty.

m_mimeType

protected String m_mimeType
The IANA name for the type (e.g., text/plain). Initialized in constructor, never null or empty.

m_charset

protected String m_charset
The java name of the charset, if the data is text. Initialized in constructor and may benull or empty if mime type is binary.

m_checkSum

protected long m_checkSum
Checksum over m_streamData, set by setChecksum(long), defaults to -1.

m_totalLength

protected long m_totalLength
The actual length of the content. This defaults to -1 to specified it hasn't been calculated. Set using setResourceDataLength(long) accessors. Get using getResourceDataLength().

m_status

protected String m_status
The status of the object. Initialized to null, only modified by setStatus(String)

m_locator

protected PSLocator m_locator
The information that can be used to locate the content in the Rhythmyx server. Initialized to null, only modified by setLocator. It will remain to be null for static items.

Constructor Detail

PSItemContext

public PSItemContext(String resourceId,
                     InputStream data,
                     String mimetype)
Creates and initializes the context using the supplied properties of a resource.

Parameters:
resourceId - a resource identifier that uniquely identifies the item being created. This depends on the content selector and might be a url, file, etc. Not null or empty.
data - The raw data from the resource. May be null. This class does not take ownership of the stream. However, it does immediately read all available data during ctor initialization so the calling method can close the stream upon return.
mimetype - The IANA name for the type (e.g., text/plain). Must be supplied.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if data is null or mimetype is null or empty.

PSLoaderException - if any other error occurs.

getResourceId

public String getResourceId()
Get the resource identifier of this item.

Returns:
the resource identifier uniquely identifying this item in the tree, never null or empty.

getResourceFileName

public String getResourceFileName()
Get the file name from the resource identifier, which does not include the file extension if there is any. For example, if the resource identifier is: ../country/flag.gif, then the file name is: "flag".

Returns:
The retrieved file name, never null or empty.

getResourceMimeType

public String getResourceMimeType()
This is the mime type of the resource obtained during scanning. If the type could not be determined during scanning, then the mime-type will attempt to be determined using the resource's extension and a mime-map. If the resource does not have an extension, a guess is made by looking at a few characters and picking either text/plain or application/octet-stream.

Returns:
The IANA mime type. Never null or empty.

setResourceMimeType

public void setResourceMimeType(String strType)
Accessor to set the mime type of this resource.

Parameters:
strType - mimetype string. Never null or empty.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if strType is invalid.

getResourceCharset

public String getResourceCharset()
This is the IANA character set of the original resource, if available. If not available, the default platform character set is used for text resources and the empty string is returned for non-text resources.

Returns:
The IANA name for the character set of the original resource.

getResourceDataLength

public long getResourceDataLength()
Returns:
The number of bytes in the resource read by the scanner (not necessarily the number of chars in the String). May be -1 to represent it has not been set.

setResourceDataLength

public void setResourceDataLength(long bytes)
Parameters:
bytes - The number of bytes in the resource read by the scanner (not necessarily the number of chars in the String).

getItem

public PSClientItem getItem()
This object is created with the data from a resource. It is then analyzed and converted to some standard item format by an static entity. Once that processed item has been placed in this context, it is available with this method.

Returns:
The object representation of the item, never null. This is an object representing the StandardItem.xsd schema. The returned object is not a copy, so any changes made affect the object owned by this context. Even though this is true, if the caller makes any changes to the object, they should call setItem(com.percussion.cms.objectstore.ws.PSClientItem) again to notify the context of these changes. This allows the context to perform caching and other optimizations wisely.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - If this method is called before the setItem(PSClientItem) method has been called.

setItem

public void setItem(PSClientItem item)
See getItem() for a description.

Parameters:
item - The Rhythmyx item extracted from the resource associated with this context. Never null. This method takes ownership of the item and the calling class should not change the item after it has called this method.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if item is null.

clearCachedContent

public void clearCachedContent()
Clear the cached content, which may be set by setItem(PSClientItem) or setStaticData(byte[]). This should be called after the content is no longer needed, so that the memory can be G.C.'ed.

getStandardItemDoc

public Document getStandardItemDoc()
If an item has been set on this context, that item is converted to the StandardItem.xsd schema format and returned.

Returns:
The current item as a Standard Item formatted document, never null.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - If called before the item has been set on this context.

getStatus

public String getStatus()
The item status is an indicator of this item's 'newness'. i.e., it is one of the STATUS_xxx values.

Returns:
The value set by the setStatus(String) method. The default status is new. Never null or empty.
See Also:
STATUS_ERROR, STATUS_EXCLUDED, STATUS_MODIFIED, STATUS_NEW, STATUS_UNCHANGED

setStatus

public void setStatus(String status)
See getStatus() for details.

Parameters:
status - One of the STATUS_xxx values. The locator will be set to null if it is STATUS_NEW.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if newStatus is not one of the STATUS_xxx values.

getChecksum

public long getChecksum()
Accessor to read the checksum for the item. This checksum is calculated over the original bytes, which is from IPSContentSelector.retrieve(IPSContentTreeNode).

Returns:
long value representing the checksum, -1 if has not been set yet.

public void setChecksum(long checksum)

Parameters:
checksum - The to be set checksum
